identificationModule.briefTitle: Effects of an Exercise Program on Reaction Time and Mouse Accuracy in Esports Athletes
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effects of an Exercise Program on Reaction Time and Mouse Accuracy in Esports Athletes

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study is intended to evaluate the effects of an exercise program on the change of electronic sports (esports) athletes' reaction time and mouse click accuracy. The benefits of participation are directly related to exercise, and include improved thinking, performance, sleep, and quality of life.

armGroups.label: Resistance combined with cardiovascular training group
armGroups.description: Participants in this group will receive the resistance combined with cardiovascular training intervention for up to 6 weeks
interventionNames: Other: Resistance combined with cardiovascular training

interventions.name: Resistance combined with cardiovascular training
interventions.description: Participants will undergo a 6-week exercise program designed under the supervision of a board certified sports medicine physician. The exercise program will consist of a 3 day per week schedule: Monday will be lower body resistance training, Wednesday will be aerobic exercise, and Friday will be upper body resistance training. Each session will be approximately up to 1 hour.
armGroupLabels: Resistance combined with cardiovascular training group

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in participants' physical reaction time
primaryOutcomes.description: Participants' reaction time will be measured in milliseconds using open-source software "Open-source open-access reaction time test"
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and up to 6 weeks after starting the program

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in percentage of participants' mouse click accuracy
primaryOutcomes.description: Participants' mouse click accuracy will be measured as a percentage using a web-based program, "Mouse Accuracy"
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and up to 6 weeks after starting the program

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in participants' number of target efficiency
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in participants' number of target efficiency will be calculated as number of hits divided by possible targets using "Mouse Accuracy"
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and up to 6 weeks after starting the program

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in participants' clicks per second
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in participants' clicks per second will be measured by counting actual mouse clicks per second using "Mouse Accuracy"
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and up to 6 weeks after starting the program

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. University of Miami electronic sports (esports) club team members

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Non- University of Miami electronic sports (esports) club team members
2. Individuals who are not able to participate in a full body exercise program, whether due to injury or an underlying medical condition
3. Individuals who cannot comprehend basic instruction on exercise whether due to a cognitive impairment or language barrier (ie: non-English speaker).
